definition: to kill sb/to murder
to do harm to/to cause trouble to/harm/evil/calamity
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc
to plot and kill sb for his property (idiom); to murder for money
see 謀財害命|谋财害命[mou2 cai2 hai4 ming4]

sentences.english: My powers cannot be used to harm.
sentences.chinese: 我的能力不能用來害命。

sentences.english: Wasting other people's time is tantamount to robbery or murder.
sentences.chinese: 浪費別人的時間就等於謀財害命。

sentences.english: Sinclair marries wealthy men and murders them for inheritance.
sentences.chinese: 辛克萊會嫁給有錢人，然後謀財害命。

sentences.english: The detective reasoned that David had been murdered for his money.
sentences.chinese: 偵探推斷戴維被人謀財害命了。

definition: to harm sb/to inflict suffering/to victimize/pernicious
to plot and kill sb for his property (idiom); to murder for money
see 謀財害命|谋财害命[mou2 cai2 hai4 ming4]
to have disregard for human life (idiom)
to kill and burn (idiom); murder and arson
to kill sb for his property (idiom); to murder for money
willfully slaughter the innocent (idiom)
bad person/evildoer/robber
devoid of conscience (idiom); utterly heartless
death cannot wipe out the crimes (idiom); dreadful crimes that rankled even after the perpetrator is dead
to flout the law
guilty of terrible crimes (idiom)/reprehensible
homicide/to murder/to kill (a person)
against one's conscience
to torment the people (idiom)
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
